newsitem.title: USA: FORECAST-Experts eye U.S. GDP, home sales Aug 26.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Experts eye U.S. GDP, home sales Aug 26.

text.p: Next week's report on revised second quarter gross domestic product (GDP) may suggest the U.S. economy continues to grow strongly in the third quarter, said economists in a Reuters poll.
On average, 25 economists surveyed on Friday forecast Commerce's second estimate at last quarter's GDP will be unchanged at 4.2 percent.
While a GDP revision might normally get little attention, economists said they were looking to components of the report for hints at third-quarter growth.
Even if the headline GDP figure remains the same, some experts said, upward revisions in other aspects of the report could point to faster-than-expected economic growth in the current quarter.
"We see final sales being revised higher, which means inventories are lower and growth could be stronger in the third quarter," said Jonathan Basile, an economist at HSBC Securities Inc.
Friday's report on July durable goods orders and the recently reported rise in July industrial production suggested third quarter growth would remain swift, Basile said.
Economists ascribed some of the rise in second-quarter GDP to a healthy housing market and they said next week's home sales reports could offset certain portions of the GDP report.
Respondents forecast existing home sales fell to a 4.1 million unit annual rate in July from 4.18 million in June.
"The housing market remains relatively healthy, (but) we could get some fallback as the year progresses," said Raphael Marrone, a senior analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell.
The July existing homes report is scheduled for Monday at 1000EDT/1400GMT and GDP is set for release on Thursday at 0830EDT/1230GMT.
